*'''Smoking trends:''''
**After several years of stability, the proportion of smokers fell by 12% between 2016 and 2018 (i.e. 1.6 million fewer smokers).
**the factors behind the reduction: sharp rise in prices/neutral pack/"Month Without Smoking" operation.
*'''Slight decrease in overall smoking (2017: 31.8% / 2018: 32%)''''
**Decrease in daily smoking (2017: 26.9% / 2018: 25.4%)
**increase in occasional smoking (2017: 4.9% / 2018: 6.6%)
*'''By age group''''
**decrease among men in all age groups
**decrease among women aged under 55 / increase among women aged 55-75

question.question: Between 2017 and 2018, what was the trend in smoking behavior among women?
question.option_a: There was a decrease in smoking among women in all age groups.
question.option_b: There was an increase in smoking among women aged 55-75 and a decrease among those under 55.
question.option_c: There was a consistent decrease in smoking across all age groups for women.
question.option_d: There was an overall increase in smoking among women due to a rise in occasional smoking.
